CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1964, pg. 2 reads: "Brotherhood Award - The Brotherhood Award for the most outstanding non-Irish marching group in recent St. Patrick's Day parade was won by the Hill City Drill Team. Shown at the award ceremonies are (left to right) G. Harold Griffin, director of HIll City; Assistant Superintendent of Police Lawrence J. Maloney, parade chairman and marshal; Mayor Joseph M. Barr, who made the presentation; Raymond J. Harris, director of the Hill City Drill Team; Sharyn Madden, Clifford Robinson, Sherry Ware, Wilbert Boyd, Elaine Broan and Charles Humphries, all members of the drill team. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: G. Harold Griffin, Lawrence J. Maloney, Mayor Joseph M. Barr, presenting Brotherhood Award to the Hill City Drill Team, including director Raymond J. Harris, and members Sharyn Madden, Clifford Robinson, Sherry Ware, Wilbert Boyd, Elaine Broan, and Charles Humphries, posed in Mayor's office
